hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
source /home/test/.bashrc #Check available version in repo : rhel6.9 package_name="ruby" published_version="2.5.0"
available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) PRETTY_NAME="Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.9 (Santiago)"
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo for $PRETTY_NAME." echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
# Install dependencies sudo yum install -y bison openssl-devel libyaml-devel libffi-devel readline-devel zlib-devel gdbm-devel ncurses-devel tcl-devel tk-devel sqlite-devel gcc make wget tar bzip2 svn subversion gcc-c++ binutils-devel
# Set environment variables export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
#Install GCC 4.8.2 export WORK_DIR=`pwd` cd $WORK_DIR wget http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/gcc/gcc-4.8.2/gcc-4.8.2.tar.bz2 tar xvf gcc-4.8.2.tar.bz2 cd gcc-4.8.2 ./contrib/download_prerequisites mkdir $WORK_DIR/gccbuild cd $WORK_DIR/gccbuild ../gcc-4.8.2/configure --prefix="/opt/gcc" --enable-shared --with-system-zlib --enable-threads=posix --enable-__cxa_atexit --enable-checking --enable-gnu-indirect-function --enable-languages="c,c++" --disable-bootstrap --disable-multilib make all sudo make install export PATH=/opt/gcc/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/gcc/lib64:/opt/gcc/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH sudo mv /usr/bin/gcc /usr/bin/gcc.bkup sudo ln -s /opt/gcc/bin/gcc /usr/bin/gcc gcc --version
# Download Ruby 2.5.0 source code wget http://cache.ruby-lang.org/pub/ruby/2.5/ruby-2.5.0.tar.gz tar zxf ruby-2.5.0.tar.gz cd ruby-2.5.0
# Configure and build Ruby ./configure make
# Install Ruby sudo -E make install
# Test the results make test
# Verify Ruby
ruby -v ruby -v | grep 2.5.0 gem env gem env
